subject: Self Care
title: The Science of Self-Compassion
description: A quick, practical guide to The Science of Self-Compassion.

hook.text: Self-compassion lowers cortisol, increases heart rate variability, and activates the caregiving system. It's biology.

buildup.text: When you're self-critical, the threat system activates: cortisol spikes, muscles tense, fight-or-flight engages.

discovery.text: Self-compassion activates the mammalian care system instead: oxytocin releases, heart rate slows, the body calms.

twist.text: Self-criticism was supposed to motivate you. Instead, it triggers the stress response that impairs performance.

climax.text: Self-compassion isn't soft. It's neurologically effective. It creates the calm state where real growth happens.

punchline.text: Kindness calms the nervous system. Criticism activates threat mode.

quiz.question: What biological system does self-compassion activate?
options: The mammalian care system releasing oxytocin
